review: I've had this for three weeks and I love it.  easy to navigate menus, quick set up, and the ability  to play many android games on my tv.  I purchased the game controller as well just for that reason.  Since I purchased this I haven't turned on my old  xbox360 since this has all the apps I use.  Games are not next gen in terms of graphics or gameplay, but for the chance to get a shooter, racer, etc that is decent in gameplay and costs $45-$55 less than they do for the consoles is a big win to me.

review: I thought I was getting something better than what I bought.  I apparently I misunderstood what I could stream for free.  It appears that I need to have a NetFlix and other monthly subscriptions to see what I wanted to view.  I'm going to have to keep cable to watch current news.  I do get to watch lots of movies...but I didn't buy it to watch movies - I wanted to watch TV shows.  Granted I can, but I have to have either subscriptions or wait for them to be part of Fire TV streaming for free.  It doesn't meet my expectations.  For instance, I have to pay $1.99 or $2.99 (depending on the episode) to watch season one of House of Cards.
